summary: This document contains notes from a November 14, 2021 meeting with Janusz Banasiak (JB) to prepare for trial testimony. It records JB's recollections about his employment for Jeffrey Epstein (JE), including details about his hiring, travel, and a police search of Epstein's Palm Beach house.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein (JE) who is being prepared for trial testimony. He provides recollections about his hiring, work duties, travel with Epstein, and witnessing a police search of Epstein's Palm Beach house.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE. He employed Janusz Banasiak (JB). JB recalls traveling with him, picking him up from the airport, and that Epstein's Palm Beach house was searched by police.

connections.description: Banasiak was employed by Epstein, who provided him with a car, plane tickets, and relocation assistance.
Banasiak picked up GM along with Epstein from the airport on his first day of work. He later interacted with GM less frequently at the Palm Beach house.
GM was traveling with Epstein when picked up by Banasiak, indicating a social or professional connection.

events.title: Police search of Epstein's Palm Beach house
events.description: Police conducted a search of Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house. Janusz Banasiak, along with architects and designers, were present outside while the search was conducted. Epstein was supposed to show up but did not.

events.title: Janusz Banasiak's hiring and first days of work
events.description: Banasiak's first day of work for Epstein began in New York, where he was given a car and picked up Epstein and GM from Teterboro Airport. After a few days, he flew commercially to Palm Beach to begin work, later returning to New York on Epstein's plane.

events.title: Trial preparation meeting with Janusz Banasiak
events.description: A meeting was held to prepare Janusz Banasiak for providing trial testimony, during which he disclosed various recollections about his time working for Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Janusz Banasiak, a former Epstein employee, recalls a police search of Epstein's Palm Beach house occurring around 2006.
On his first day of work, Banasiak picked up Jeffrey Epstein and an associate (GM) from Teterboro Airport in a car provided by Epstein.
Banasiak states that GM's visits to the Palm Beach house became less frequent after approximately two years.
The document is a pre-trial preparation note, indicating Banasiak was being prepared to testify in a legal proceeding related to Epstein.
